channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2023080486
item.description:
Report X-2023080486

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: unload reported a damaged hazmat package, QA team member responded and secured package and applied absorbent pad to spillage and took the package to the hazmat cage DescribePack: upon inspection, the closure appeared to be loose resulting in the consequent spillage of its contents DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: absorbent pad was applied and removed as soon as the spill was absorbed

item.title: Report X-2023080481
item.description:
Report X-2023080481

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The leaking carton was removed from sort, placed in a lined tote and brought to the QA area. DescribePack: The spray caps on three of the bottles were completely off and another was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The leaking package was placed in a lined tote. The spillage was mostly confined to the caron and tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080307
item.description:
Report X-2023080307

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded from trailer # 819078 from 389-OLIV at door 116 in unload. QA was in area and witnessed package being removed from trailer with visible old damage from leaking contents. QA immediately engaged and used appropriate materials and procedures to mitigate further release. DescribePack: The cap on one of the containers was slightly loose. Additional investigation revealed SPIDR images showing package not oriented correctly while traveling the IC belt at 389-OLIV, which may have contributed to the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA was on scene as package was being unloaded and took immediate action to mitigate release.

item.title: Report X-2023070359
item.description:
Report X-2023070359

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: JACKSON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 5th, a package was discovered during the PM sort. The package shows it to be a KYB Gas Shock Absorber. The specialist thought that that pneumatic or hydraulic devices can be dangerous goods. After reviewing the SDS for the product it was determined to be UN3164 Articles, pressurized pneumatic or hydraulic(containing non-flammable gas), 2.2. The shipment is being held pending further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023080282
item.description:
Report X-2023080282

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking at the unload side. The package was put in hazardous bag and into a red tote. The red tote was delivered to QA cage for further inspection. DescribePack: 2 of the 4 1-gallon bottle had a loose causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When the package was found leaking, it was placed in a hazardous bag and into a red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080260
item.description:
Report X-2023080260

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: MOUNT JULIET
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME INTO ENAS AS AN RTS - ALREADY REPACKED - NO HAZMAT MARKINGS ON OUTER CONTAINER. PACKAGE WAS FOUND AT ANOTHER STATION - LAST SCAN WAS 5/22/23 - HOW DAMAGE OCCURED IS UNKNOWN - EMAILS SENT TO SENDING STATION TO TRY AND GET MORE INFORMATION ON THE PACKAGE ITSELF. NO ONE HAS A CLUE HOW IT GOT DAMAGED, REPACKED OR WHERE THE PACKAGE HAS BEEN SINCE 5/22/23. DescribePack: UNKNOWN - ONE BOTTLE IS ABOUT 1/2 EMPTY - PLASTIC BAGS BOTTELS SHIPPED IN ALSO WET. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: MOVED TO HAZMAT CAGE

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 55 gallon drum of echo treat (un3264) had been punctured by a nail and had released 12 ounces of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: When discovered, the package was immediately placed in a lined tote and brought to the HWPA. DescribePack: The side of the plastic bottle was split open due to impact. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined tote and brought to the HWPA. The product was shipped in a plastic bag, which limited spillage.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package mitigation consisted of putting package in an open contents bin and leaving it for OB QA.

BOTH CONTENTS WAS SOILED AND STAINED DUE TO LIQUID EXPELLED DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: TURNED UP RIGHT AND CAP TIGHTENED

item.title: Report X-2023070461
item.description:
Report X-2023070461

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box containing a class 8 was found in the Memphis dangerous goods building with signs of release. While investigating the package the spill agent discovered that one of the six glass bottles had a small crack on the bottom. The bottles were packaged in molded Styrofoam mold top and bottom. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023070338
item.description:
Report X-2023070338

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-04
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/3/2023 at approximately 2220, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5006446 at the hub facility in Memphs, reporting a flammable spill. The shipment consisted of 8 fiberboard boxes, each containing 1 metal can. Two of the packages appeared wet on the bottom. Further inspection revealed the closure of the metal can were compromised. The cause of the damage is unknown. The spillage has been contained and the undamaged pieces were placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023070334
item.description:
Report X-2023070334

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-01
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/1/2023 at approximately 0330, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 245975 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a fire extinguisher spill. The shipment consisted of 6 fire extinguishers, 2 of which completely discharged, cause unknown. The remaning 4 extinguishers are awaiting an amended shipper's declaration for return transport.

item.title: Report X-2023070252
item.description:
Report X-2023070252

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to the Dangerous Goods building for a fiberboard box with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained four metal jerrycans inside of a single plastic bag. Two of the cans were damaged on the bottom chime but only one of them released it's contents inside of the bag/box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023070001
item.description:
Report X-2023070001

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 29th this package containing UN1268, Petroleum distillates n.o.s., 3, II was found leaking on the belt. upon investigating and opening the package the inner receptacle was found to have completely broken, releasing the entire contents. The Shipper was notified and the package and remaining pieces of the inner receptacle sent for disposal.

  • Description: THE SHIPMENT WAS DISCOVERED DURING SORT OPERATIONS. OUTER PACKAGING IS MFG. LABELLED AS "GAS A JUST KYB AMERICAS" 2 BOXES TAPED TOGETHER WITH SHIPPING LABEL. SDS STATES UN 3164 ARTICLES PRESSURIZED OR HYDRAULIC (CONTAINING NON FLAMMABLE GAS) THERE WAS NO RELEASE. THE SHIPMENT WAS HELD FOR FAA INVESTIGATION

item.title: Report X-2023070078
item.description:
Report X-2023070078

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to the Dangerous Goods building for a leaking package. Upon arrival the agent was told that the fiberboard box fell off the rollers and struck the edge of the catwalk. This punctured the fiberboard box and one of the two metal jerrycans inside. The jerrycans were packaged with Styrofoam molding for bracing and bubble wrap for dunnage. Each jerrycan was enclosed in a single plastic bag sealed with a bag tie. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.
